<|ref|>title<|/ref|><|det|>[[97, 118, 379, 144]]<|/det|>
# Cambridge IGCSE™  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[97, 170, 183, 187]]<|/det|>
## PHYSICS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[97, 193, 368, 210]]<|/det|>
Paper 2 Multiple Choice (Extended)  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 246, 507, 263]]<|/det|>
You must answer on the multiple choice answer sheet.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[97, 277, 437, 285]]<|/det|>
You will need: Multiple choice answer sheet  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[215, 286, 539, 317]]<|/det|>
Soft clean eraser Soft pencil (type B or HB is recommended)  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[97, 337, 228, 352]]<|/det|>
## INSTRUCTIONS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[97, 354, 880, 520]]<|/det|>
INSTRUCTIONS- There are forty questions on this paper. Answer all questions.- For each question there are four possible answers A, B, C and D. Choose the one you consider correct and record your choice in soft pencil on the multiple choice answer sheet.- Follow the instructions on the multiple choice answer sheet.- Write in soft pencil.- Write your name, centre number and candidate number on the multiple choice answer sheet in the spaces provided unless this has been done for you.- Do not use correction fluid.- Do not write on any bar codes.- You may use a calculator.- Take the weight of \(1.0 \text{kg}\) to be \(9.8 \text{N}\) (acceleration of free fall \(= 9.8 \text{m/s}^2\)).  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[97, 548, 220, 563]]<|/det|>
## INFORMATION  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[97, 564, 571, 612]]<|/det|>
INFORMATION- The total mark for this paper is 40.- Each correct answer will score one mark.- Any rough working should be done on this question paper.

forcefrequency

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[79, 437, 107, 456]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 437, 655, 456]]<|/det|> On a warm day, a carton of fresh milk is covered with a wet cloth. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 467, 594, 486]]<|/det|> Why does this help to reduce the temperature of the milk? <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 496, 134, 514]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 496, 803, 514]]<|/det|> Some water evaporates from the cloth so the remaining water becomes cooler. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 523, 134, 541]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 523, 556, 541]]<|/det|> The water has a very high specific heat capacity. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 550, 133, 567]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 549, 616, 567]]<|/det|> The water insulates the milk from the warm air around it. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 575, 133, 593]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 575, 520, 593]]<|/det|> Water is always colder than the air around it. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[79, 619, 106, 636]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 618, 512, 636]]<|/det|> A chef heats some water in a pan on a hotplate. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 650, 551, 667]]<|/det|> The temperature of the water rises by \(10^{\circ}\mathrm{C}\) in time \(t\). <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 680, 761, 697]]<|/det|> She then puts the same volume of oil in an identical pan on the same hotplate. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 710, 900, 728]]<|/det|> The specific heat capacity of water is 2.5 times that of oil and water is 1.1 times denser than oil. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 740, 631, 758]]<|/det|> What is the time for the temperature of the oil to rise by \(10^{\circ}\mathrm{C}\) ? <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 769, 134, 787]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 769, 198, 787]]<|/det|> 0.36\(t\) <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[281, 769, 311, 787]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[331, 769, 368, 787]]<|/det|> 0.44\(t\) <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[447, 769, 475, 787]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[485, 769, 522, 787]]<|/det|> 2.3\(t\) <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[615, 769, 635, 787]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[640, 769, 688, 787]]<|/det|> 2.8\(t\)

Man P cannot see man Q but man P can hear man Q speaking. <|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[396, 523, 594, 650]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 661, 376, 680]]<|/det|> Which statement explains this? <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 689, 134, 707]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 689, 761, 707]]<|/det|> Light waves do not diffract at all because they are electromagnetic waves. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 715, 134, 733]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 715, 771, 733]]<|/det|> Light waves have a range of frequencies but sound has just one frequency. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 742, 134, 759]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 742, 620, 759]]<|/det|> Sound waves are of a higher frequency than light waves. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 768, 134, 786]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 768, 905, 785]]<|/det|> Sound waves diffract a lot because their wavelength is a similar size to the width of the gap.

<label>D</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 702, 697, 720]]<|/det|>
